intro: Castanopsis bodinieri, commonly known as the Bodinier tamarack, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its persistent, scaly leaves. The tree produces small, spiny fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the genus Castanopsis. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in mixed forests with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
